definition: the elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level
the altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air

preferred_unit: cubic meter per minute, liters per second
definition: ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises
carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

preferred_unit: meter per second, kilometer per hour
definition: speed of wind measured at the time of sampling
wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates
methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

preferred_unit: watts per square meter, ergs per square centimeter per second
definition: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
oxygenation status of sample
carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
temperature of the sample at time of sampling

long_name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
definition: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction
any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v 111), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI
force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface

preferred_unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
definition: oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
ventilation system used in the sampled premises

preferred_unit: microgram per cubic meter, parts per million
definition: concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound
duration for which sample was stored

preferred_unit: number of organism per cubic meter
definition: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

preferred_unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
definition: pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant

salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration
location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM
surface materials at the point of sampling
contaminant identified on surface
partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air
actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture
surfaces: water activity as a function of air and material moisture
temperature of the air at the time of sampling
temperature of the surface at the time of sampling
pH measurement of surface
the primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

preferred_unit: parts per million, gram per cubic meter, gram per square meter
definition: water held on a surface
the temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water.

ventilation system used in the sampled premises

preferred_unit: number of organism per cubic meter
definition: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts
a distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used
type of indoor surface

syntax: [particulate air filter|chemical air filter|low-MERV pleated media|HEPA|electrostatic|gas-phase or ultraviolet air treatments.]
definition: a device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants

syntax: [radiant system|heat pump|forced air system|steam forced heat|wood stove]
definition: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building
the substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level
a location (geography) where a building is set

application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light

syntax: open face filter collecting total suspended particles, "prefilter to remove particles larger than X micrometers in diameter, where common values of X would be 10 and 2.5 full size sorting in a cascade impactor"
definition: method by which samples are sorted
customary or normal state of the space
customary or normal density of occupants
number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space
average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

the elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level

definition: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

preferred_unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
definition: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens
information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

long_name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
definition: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction
treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)
temperature of the sample at time of sampling
salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration
treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens
information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples
measurement of wet mass

expected_value: mineral nutrient name;mineral nutrient amount;treatment duration;interval;experimental duration
preferred_unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
definition: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens
description of plant tissue culture growth media used
total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

expected_value: growth hormone name;growth hormone amount;treatment duration;interval;experimental duration
preferred_unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
definition: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens
duration for which sample was stored

list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. the value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text
NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens
information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v 111), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI
type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types
location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room
temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius
phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO
the length of subject
taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level

substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from
information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens
common name of the host, e.g. human

preferred_unit: number of organism per cubic meter
definition: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts
age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

preferred_unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter

commonly called 'slope'. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer

the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315 degrees. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.
cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas
drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.
reference or method used in determining soil texture

reference or method used in determining pH
